title: Make sheet music build vertically with wrapping and reorganize app layout

requirements.text: Update the SheetMusic component in frontend/src/components/SheetMusic.tsx to implement vertical wrapping behavior similar to OcarinaTablature, where the sheet music wraps to new lines when it reaches the screen edge instead of extending horizontally to the right

quotes: they should build vertical like the ocarina tablature is doing, not how the sheet music just extends into the right

acceptanceCriteria: Sheet music wraps to new lines when reaching the screen edge
Vertical wrapping behavior matches the OcarinaTablature component's responsive behavior
No horizontal overflow or horizontal scrolling required for sheet music

requirements.text: Reorganize the MusicEditor component in frontend/src/components/MusicEditor.tsx to display components in the following order from top to bottom: ocarina illustration (OcarinaIllustration), piano keyboard (PianoKeyboard), ocarina tablature (OcarinaTablature), sheet music (SheetMusic), and lyrics editor (LyricsEditor) at the bottom

quotes: Tablature shows on-top op sheet music

acceptanceCriteria: Ocarina illustration appears at the top of the layout
Piano keyboard is positioned directly below the ocarina illustration
Ocarina tablature is positioned below the piano keyboard
Sheet music is positioned below the ocarina tablature
Lyrics editor is positioned at the bottom of the layout

constraints: Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or other immutable paths
Maintain existing responsive wrapping behavior from OcarinaTablature when implementing sheet music wrapping
nonGoals: Changing the functionality of any existing components beyond layout positioning
Modifying the sheet music notation rendering logic beyond wrapping behavior
